unnormalised: ## New Wheels Alert! What's Hot in the Indian Auto Scene?
normalised: ## New Wheels Alert! What's Hot in the Indian Auto Scene?

unnormalised: Namaste, auto enthusiasts! Get ready to rev your engines because the Indian automotive market is buzzing with new launches. Forget your chai break, you need to know about these!
normalised: Namaste, auto enthusiasts! Get ready to rev your engines because the Indian automotive market is buzzing with new launches. Forget your chai break, you need to know about these!

unnormalised: First up, Maruti Suzuki finally unveiled the new-gen Alto 800... or is it something else? Rumours are flying about a possible name change. All we know is, it’s supposed to be super fuel-efficient, perfect for those crazy Delhi traffic jams. Expect a price tag starting around Rs. 4 Lakhs.
normalised: First up, Maruti Suzuki finally unveiled the new-gen Alto eight hundred... or is it something else? Rumours are flying about a possible name change. All we know is, it’s supposed to be super fuel-efficient, perfect for those crazy Delhi traffic jams. Expect a price tag starting around rupee four lakhs.

unnormalised: Then there's Mahindra. They're teasing us with glimpses of their new SUV, tentatively called the XUV400 (electric, maybe?). It’s supposed to be a direct competitor to the Tata Nexon EV. Imagine cruising around Mumbai, completely emission-free! We're talking some serious competition brewing.
normalised: Then there's Mahindra. They're teasing us with glimpses of their new S U V, tentatively called the X U V four hundred (electric, maybe?). It’s supposed to be a direct competitor to the Tata Nexon E V. Imagine cruising around Mumbai, completely emission-free! We're talking some serious competition brewing.

unnormalised: MG Motor India, not to be left behind, just launched a refreshed Hector with some serious tech upgrades. We're talking voice commands, a massive touchscreen display, and maybe even ADAS features! Think futuristic driving experience, right here in India. My Naniji would be impressed, even if she still prefers her Ambassador.
normalised: M G Motor India, not to be left behind, just launched a refreshed Hector with some serious tech upgrades. We're talking voice commands, a massive touchscreen display, and maybe even A D A S features! Think futuristic driving experience, right here in India. My Naniji would be impressed, even if she still prefers her Ambassador.

unnormalised: Tata Motors isn’t sleeping either. Remember the Curvv concept they showcased at the Auto Expo? Well, sources say a production version is closer than we think. A coupe-SUV? In India? This could be a game-changer!
normalised: Tata Motors isn’t sleeping either. Remember the Curvv concept they showcased at the Auto Expo? Well, sources say a production version is closer than we think. A coupe-S U V? In India? This could be a game-changer!

unnormalised: And let's not forget about the two-wheeler scene! Ola Electric recently inaugurated its Futurefactory, boasting a massive production capacity across 43 acres (that's a LOT of sq ft!). They're promising to ramp up production and deliveries of the S1 and S1 Pro scooters, easing the waiting periods that have been driving everyone nuts.
normalised: And let's not forget about the two-wheeler scene! Ola Electric recently inaugurated its Futurefactory, boasting a massive production capacity across forty three acres (that's a LOT of square feet!). They're promising to ramp up production and deliveries of the S one and S one Pro scooters, easing the waiting periods that have been driving everyone nuts.

unnormalised: Dr. Ravi Kumar at IIT Madras says these launches indicate a healthy and growing market. More options for us, the consumers! So, are you ready to upgrade your ride? I'm definitely eyeing that XUV400! Which one are you looking at? Let me know in the comments!
normalised: Doctor Ravi Kumar at I I T Madras says these launches indicate a healthy and growing market. More options for us, the consumers! So, are you ready to upgrade your ride? I'm definitely eyeing that X U V four hundred! Which one are you looking at? Let me know in the comments!
